articles.title: Francis, Zrno lead Rutgers in 68-57 victory over Maryland
articles.original_title: Francis, Zrno lead Rutgers in 68-57 victory over Maryland
articles.summary: Tariq Francis scored 21 points, Harun Zrno added 13, and Rutgers defeated Maryland 68-57 on Sunday, lifting the Scarlet Knights out of the Big Ten cellar.  Zrno hit three 3-pointers and scored 11 of Rutgers' first 15 second-half points as the Scarlet Knights built a 42-34 lead through the first seven minutes after halftime.  Maryland cut the deficit to five points a couple of times and the Terrapins were still within 60-54 with two minutes left.

articles.title: Moustapha Thiam has 15 points, 10 rebounds and 4 blocks; Cincinnati beats Utah 69-65
articles.original_title: Moustapha Thiam has 15 points, 10 rebounds and 4 blocks; Cincinnati beats Utah 69-65
articles.summary: CINCINNATI (AP) — Moustapha Thiam had 15 points, 10 rebounds and four blocks, Day Day Thomas scored 16 points, and Cincinnati beat Utah 69-65 on Sunday to extend the Utes skid to seven consecutive games. Thiam, a 7-foot-2 sophomore, had his fifth career double-double and his third this season. Baba Miller had 13 points and eight rebounds for Cincinnati (14-12, 6-7 Big 12) and Keyshuan Tillery scored 10 points. The Bearcats have won three straight for the first time since they started the season

articles.title: Leipzig’s Champions League hopes hit by 2-2 draw with lowly Wolfsburg in Bundesliga
articles.original_title: Leipzig’s Champions League hopes hit by 2-2 draw with lowly Wolfsburg in Bundesliga
articles.summary: Leipzig’s Champions League hopes took a blow in a 2-2 draw with lowly Wolfsburg in the Bundesliga on Sunday.  It could have been worse for the Red Bull-backed club with Brajan Gruda salvaging the draw in the 89th minute and Leipzig goalkeeper Maarten Vandevoordt saving Christian Eriksen’s effort from the last kick of the game.  Leipzig dropped to fifth, two points behind Stuttgart and just a point above Bayer Leverkusen with 12 rounds remaining.

articles.title: Double Olympic gold for Matt Weston, who pairs with Tabitha Stoecker to win mixed skeleton title
articles.original_title: Double Olympic gold for Matt Weston, who pairs with Tabitha Stoecker to win mixed skeleton title
articles.summary: CORTINA D'AMPEZZO, Italy (AP) — Britain's Matt Weston waited a lifetime to capture his first Olympic skeleton gold medal.  Weston and Tabitha Stoecker won the mixed skeleton event on Sunday night, their two-run combined time of 1 minute, 59.36 seconds good enough to get another Olympic gold for Britain — its fifth in skeleton since 2010, by far the most of any nation in that span.  Weston won the men's skeleton gold medal on Friday night.

articles.title: Chris Paul retires after 21 seasons
articles.original_title: Chris Paul retires after 21 seasons
articles.summary: Chris Paul ended a 21-year NBA career this week. We still can’t believe one of those seasons was in a Warriors uniform.

articles.title: Tom Wilson fights in Canada's game vs. France at the Olympics
articles.original_title: Tom Wilson fights in Canada's game vs. France at the Olympics
articles.summary: Who says there’s no fighting in hockey at the Olympics?  Tom Wilson clearly does not care that it's shunned in international play.  Wilson dropped the gloves late in Canada’s 10-2 rout of France on Sunday, going after the player who delivered a forearm to the head of teammate Nathan MacKinnon minutes earlier.
